/common/envoy.localised_description: [HIDDEN]
Adept at knowing the idiosyncracies of human nature, this one uses their skills to ensure better results.
At all times, keep a keen, surveillant ear to the ground. There may be gold among the chatter.
Your highness, a word to the wise…
Home is where the heart and, it would seem, the skill, is.
An outcast, riding into town alone.
Find a city, find myself a city to live in. A good place to get some thinking done.
The right words, chosen carefully and spoken at precisely the right moment, can mark the difference between heroic, glorious victory and ignominious, crushing defeat.
This one knows what to do and also what not to do to ensure victory in battle.
Erudite and eloquent; warriors are inspired by their words into accepting less coin for the good of the cause.
What cannot be found cannot be so easily killed.
'Tis but a scratch!
This one knows how to read the stars so that their forces may be guided more accurately.
Metaphorically speaking, having hooves is a distinct advantage when you've vast distances to travel.
There's a fine line between courage and suicide. Thus far, this one hasn't crossed it.
Efficiency in all areas keeps costs down.
Trust me, the gods will see you if you join with us, and know if you do not.
You see? The appliance of science, my friend, the appliance of science…
Committed to their kingdom and steadfast in their beliefs, this one shares their convictions, that people might think as they do.
Nobody wants to spend any time with this unpleasant person, but innate wickedness has its uses.
Harsh language, employed with precision, can be a most effective means to an end.
People are so easily provoked if you know which strings to pull.
This one knows how to frustrate, how to lead the enemy around and around in circles.
Often, the thorn in the side goes undetected for the longest time.
The enemy are that way; that's right, through the valley and down to the right.
This one is certain that the heavens are empty, and no one lives atop Mount Olympus.
Whatever the issue at hand, this one instinctively knows the correct approach to take.
Whatever it is that's required to appeal to the masses, this one has in abundance.
I'll discuss the matter with the cavalry – they'll soon come around to our way of thinking.
A master of persuasion, this one has convinced members of their target's entourage to listen carefully and relay pertinent information.
Likeable and trustworthy, this one could charm the birds from the trees.
This one's ardour borders on the annoying, but the rank and file seem to appreciate their vigour and drive.
Self-preservation should always be one's first concern, lest best-laid, long-term plans all come to nought.
Hard to find, harder to kill.
Conserve your supplies and you'll be ready for anything.
Kingdoms must learn to live within their means.
The lamia is in the detail.
This one has something about them… Even when they're lying, people are convinced they speak the truth.
By Heav'n's high will compell'd from shore to shore.
The one will share information, but has the tendency to omit some of the important details; it's a matter of strategy, you know.
Someone who knows both the cost and the price of everything is worth their weight in bronze.
A successful operator, with the tendency to stay on top, and more importantly, alive.
Know a state's inner workings in order to successfully operate there.
Payment may come in many forms. This time, it was much-needed wood to heat and shelter and cook.
Stone is a great prize, for it enables one to leave their mark on eternity. Weather permitting, of course.
The one has business interests aside from their duties, and is even willing to spend some of their own funds in their ruler's service.
Honest and dependable; you can rely on them.
A slight downpour won't wash away this one's sunny disposition.
Taking along only the most basic of necessities and essential companions ensures they reach their destination more quickly.
Come, sit by me and tell me of your woes.
See how they dance? They don't even know it, but they're entirely within my power.
An expert in manipulating others, this one enjoys a higher success rate than is usual when dealing with people.
You don't want to end up on the wrong side of this one, trust me about that.
Having a care for the pitfalls and dangers that may lie ahead shows more than prudence.
As their state's permanent representative, this person knows how everything works. Most of all, they know people and their myriad idiosyncracies.
I want the finest wines known to humanity – I want them here, and I want them now.
They call this one "Honey-tongue", and not without good reason.
The wine cup is always half full.
Watch me – like this. Now you try it.
Do not be disheartened, thy one. This is merely a setback, and a minor one at that.
Attention to detail – dotting the thetas and crossing the phis, if you will – is a most sought after skill on campaign.
Ten, for this gourd? He's offered me ten for this gourd! Ten!
The ability to convince, to appear believable, is essential if what you're really trying to do is frustrate and deceive.
When this one speaks, others invariably listen. It's a most useful skill to develop.
Hidden daggers are to be feared far more than those openly displayed.
This one has the foresight to consider any and all potential outcomes, and plan for them.
This one knows the best roads, the ones free from danger, and will tell you everything you need to know… well, almost.
Did I tell you about the time I caught their agent red-handed? They were red-throated very soon after, I can tell you!
Justice will be dispensed with a wave of the hand and an air of absolute certainty.
This one knows how, when, and crucially, where to point the finger of blame.
Take this down, before I forget…
I saw him, with mine own eyes. There is blood upon his hands! The gods know it too!
A setback is just that and nothing more. The plan is still the plan, and this one will see it through.
There's very little chance that this one will be crossing the Styx any time soon.
Judgement can be learned, but this one was born sharp and astute.
You know you can trust me, don't you?
There's very little chance that this one will be crossing the Styx any time soon.
The way I explained the situation, they'll be tied up in knots for weeks trying to think their way out of it.
This one has a truth-telling style; no matter what they say, people never see through it to the lie beneath.

/common/priestess.localised_description: [HIDDEN]
Such portents assure the shooter that his bloody work will not be in vain.
The pure of heart shall want not for courage, even in the face of death.
What was… is… and what will be. All of these things are as clear as a Spring morning.
Somehow, by some preternatural ability perhaps, this one tends to know what will be.
They'll know, they'll know that it is I that encompasses their doom!
Rituals must be performed perfectly, down to the finest detail, if the desired results are to be obtained.
If you stay here, the only way out will be death.
You really don't want to go down that road, trust me. Nothing good will come of it.
It is not this person who speaks, but the very gods themselves, using them as a vessel.
Contrition over moments of moral weakness is important, for having learned, one may be delivered from ruin as a consequence.
Truly one of the tenets of moral excellence in man; when one is honest, all may know where they stand.
Not an agent of people, but of the very gods themselves.
Misery loves company.
The gods can be tempted into serving one, if you know how to approach them...
The prescribed methods of ritual must be closely adhered to if one is to fruitfully commune with the divine.
Such things sow discord in the haunts of men... which was exactly their intention from the very beginning...
No good can come of this endeavour, only pain and suffering.
Who would believe that vast hosts of warriors would listen intently when this one speaks? Yet it is true.
Athena Pallas, protector of kingdoms, accept this offering and our prayers for your divine favour.
Unused 2
Bearing shield and spear, Athena Promachus shall lead the anointed to glory.
In times of peace, prepare for war, which surely comes again like the changing of the season.
Unused 2
The war-god demands the blood of his foes, so blood He shall most certainly have!
The Lord of the Storms assures our armies of strength and our fleets of greater reach.
Unused 1
This one will not be blown off-course and dashed against the rocks, for the storm-lord favours them and guides their hand.
Worship of the Healer assures this one of peace and normality at home.
Those who follow the averter of evil know that he will stand for them against the other gods.
To those who serve Him faithfully, Apollo offers wards against ill-health, epidemics, and evil.
For unions of all kinds are blessed and protected by the goddess' divine hand.
Unused 2
Mighty Zeus' queen, though fickle, vengeful and easily enraged, may also shield Her charges and their companions, even from certain death.
I am love personified, in no small part to Her blessings.
Unused 2
Aphrodite smiles benevolently upon Her loyal servant, helping them along the way when needed.
I am not the priestess you are looking for.
Unused 2
This one spends their days in solemn study of the divine. In return, Olympus smiles benevolently and aids their rituals.
Mighty Zeus smiles upon His faithful children, gifting His protection to those who live and die in His name.
Unused 2
The father of all the gods smiles upon His faithful servant, protects them and those with them from harm.
May their arrows, javelins and slingshot strike true.
Artemis has spoken: one shot, one kill.
Much can be learned from the entrails of the sacrifice, if you know how to interpret them.
This one's word is their bond. Let none doubt the truth of their stance.
Regret is the first step on the road to redemption in the gods' eyes.
Those selected by the gods to face their wrath shall know only dejection and regret, assuming they live...
Let us see what will be… I see a return, in strength, and for glory unending.
I advise caution – your enemies are powerful and will not show you mercy.
Two things, my lord, must ye know of the wise woman. First, she is a woman... and second, she is...
All I can think of is that the gods favour them and keep them from harm.
The gods are looking out for this one; it's the only explanation.
Flawless performance of ritual ensures that not only are the gods contacted, but their favour is secured also.
There's a certain divine purity in keeping things simple.
You can get quite far in life with an elegant turn of phrase.
With Hermes' tailwind they travel lightly and far.
The gods forgive the mistakes of those who serve them. They also grant second chances.
Fear not, brave warriors, for the gods see you this day; it is they who vie to keep or take your lives.
Passive, but not passionless. Quite the opposite in fact.
This warning speaks of the strength to stand fast against the tide of death. You have such strength within you.
Remember your training and the gods will see you through. I have seen it.
This uncanny soul knows which way the winds of war blow, and therefore just when to strike.
If Asclepius has a say in it, this one will not suffer.
The god of healing knew the way. Those who study his insights can hope to heal mortal men.
For men will not just be healed, they will be cured in their entirety, for all time, and be all the better for it.
Disciples are attracted by this one's sanctity and so assist them in their work.
Unused 2
Clearly blessed and favoured by the divine Olympians, this one's ability is clear to their people, who look to them for succour.
Perhaps you should go home to your family? Without you, they hunger.
There's no such thing as bad luck, only dark designs now come to fruition.
More than mere procedure, this one's sacred duties connect them to the gods, and must be seen through to the end.
We're not ready to see you yet, if ever.
Having succeeded, and in no small part due to their eloquent tongue, this one now has a taste for victory, which drives them ever onwards.
By the pricking of my thumbs, something wicked this way comes.
We're not ready to see you yet, if ever.
The gods look after their own.
More than merely favoured, it would seem all at Olympus keep this one from harm.

/common/spy.localised_description: [HIDDEN]
'Twas the bane of their life – literally, hah!
Act surreptitiously and with caution, and stay out of sight.
There's always a way – you just need to know where to look.
A word here, a bit of light rabble-rousing there…
It's a kindness to act in others' interests though you yourself have enough.
No stone is left unturned; each and every detail, no matter how minor, is attended to.
Upon Hermes wings they travel, and with His celerity.
A bit rough around the edges, but if anything that works to one's advantage.
Who you know is just as important as what.
Deceit isn't always the best weapon in the armoury.
No, these herbs, correctly prepared, will heal. Eaten raw, you're dead.
This one has an uncanny ability to recognise enemy plots for what they are, and put a stop to them.
I think they got 'the point', don't you think? If you take my meaning?
There's no holding some people back.
I do the "getting rid of", don't tell me why. Don't need to hear the truth, don't need the lies.
Oft-times, there's room for a certain degree of… moral flexibility, shall we say?
It took them three days to die. I would've hung around, but the conclusion was foregone.
Two drops in their wine and it's… goodnight, forever. Don't get any on your skin…
This one is adept at reading the signs, no matter how subtle, that signal future events.
Break open the best wine! Yes, the 1200BC. Such a good year.
In a world full of death in all its myriad forms, the ability to hold it back is worth its weight in gold.
Always watching, always waiting.
If at first you don't succeed, try, try and try again… until they're all dead.
Proper planning is its own reward, and especially when everything is at stake.
It took them three days to die. I know because I watched them, from my hiding place of course.
Fight fire with fire.
Sometimes, feeling no guilt whatsoever has distinct advantages.
Hit them where it really hurts – in the very structure of their civilisation.
This one knows what drives men and women, and which levers to pull to best exploit them.
The wab-priests may stretch to you their arms with libations on the soil, as it is done for Imhotep with the remains of the water bowl.
Reasoning is unnecessary when you know something in your very bones.
I know we had a plan, but no plan survives contact with the enemy – it’s the first rule of tactics.
Eyes open, mind alert. Always.
Come with me if you want to live!
This one literally has eyes everywhere due to their network of low-born informers.
The work may be improvised and crude, but when the alternative is death in agony, it's best to at least try.
[HIDDEN]
Get them drunk – well, drunker than usual. Tends to work. Sneaky, huh?
I don't want to cast doubt on the plan, but it simply will not work – not in its current form, at least.
A skilled tracker, this one knows where to find and follow the roads less travelled.
Like I said, a good man... and thorough.
Right then, you horrible lot! Five hours of drill in full armour! You can thank me later!
It pays to keep your eyes open, even in your own territory.
The successful running of a kingdom is just a matter of organisation, a thing for which some are naturally gifted.
I can see for miles and miles.
This one can make others regret they ever left the house, let alone opened their guilty mouths.
Violence isn't always necessary to achieve one's aims.
I was just looking after it for a friend…
If you trace the act back to its source, the chances are that you'll find the trail leads to this one's door.
Retreat and surrender are things that happen to other people.
It's a matter of smoke and mirrors. Mainly mirrors.
Sleep is for tortoises.
Although it is a virtuous quality, it's sad that such things seem to be necessary in a world of such riches.
Did I tell you the one about the bronze merchant and the priest of Hades? I didn't? You'll love it – it's a cracker!
Knowledge of the healing herbs and roots, along with a courageous willingness to attempt surgery, marks this one out as special.
My lord, something in the Egyptian style, perhaps?
Their wares may weigh a ton, but you can't deny craftsmanship like this.
Rest easy, good fellows, you know me – we've met before, at the festival of Dionysos. Yes, that's right – last year.
Well, I supppose there's a chance we'll all end up dead, but only a small one. You can trust me.
'Tis but a scratch!
An expert in counter-espionage, this one doesn't just put enemy plots to bed, but in the grave.
This one knows exactly how to cause the most pain with the least effort, and to keep a person wide awake throughout.
Did you really have to kill them all, the children as well?
It's almost a shame that this one's victims never see or hear them coming, and never know what hit them.
I think you know I speak the truth. You must act before they move against you.
Have you ever thought that you just might be on the wrong side of all of this?
This one will find the source of any treachery; it's only a matter of time.
We've got lumps of it 'round the back…
With this one, you always get the optimal outcome with minimal effort.
Those in power tend not to suspect their servants, but really they should!
Now, remember, the first step in avoiding a trap is knowing of its existence.
For three generations have I served this kingdom.
Failing a mission is nothing but a minor setback to them, assuming of course that they live to strike again.
There's very little chance of this one crossing the Styx any time soon.
Mmmm this is rather nice, what's in i... urrrrgh!
There's very little chance of this one crossing the Styx any time soon.
This one plans their expenses carefully, often spending much less than expected.
